alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 3:51AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 700 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 348 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over the slopes of the Kohala mountains from Upolu Point to Honokaa. Rain was falling at a rate of up to 1 inch per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kapaau, Honokaa, Kukuihaele, Waipio Valley, Waimanu Valley, Kamuela, Paauilo, Pololu Valley, Kohala Ranch, Halaula, Ookala, Hawi, Laupahoehoe, Ninole, Hakalau and Mahukona. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 700 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
